view

Class Renderable

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.Renderable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatedRenderable

    public class Renderable
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that stores all the info for the renderer to correctly display an image on the screen. Needs to be queued for rendering every single frame.
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderable

        public Renderable(java.lang.String ImageName,
          int PosX,
          int PosY,
          int Width,
          int Height,
          int DepthLevel)
        Constructor initializes a renderable. Some values get set to default values and need to be accessed using getters/setters.
        Parameters:
        ImageName - name of the file that stores the image.
        PosX - Horizontal coordinates of the top left corner of the image.
        PosY - Vertical coordiantes of the top left corner of the image.
        Width - Width of the image on the screen. Image will get resized if the value supplied doesnt match the real size.
        Height - Height of the image on the screen. Image will get resized if the value supplied doesnt match the real size.
        DepthLevel - Also known as Z level, images get sorted based on this value in the rendering queue. Images with lower Z will get rendered first and images with higher Z will be rendered last and possibly on top of already drawn images.

    • Method Detail

        public int getPositionX()
        Basic getter.
        Returns:
        horizontal position of the top left corner of the renderable.

        Basic setter.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal position of the top left corner.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the pixel data. Ideally used only by the renderer.
        Returns:
        Pixel data.

      • getDepthLevel

        public int getDepthLevel()
        Basic getter.
        Returns:
        Also known as Z level, images get sorted based on this value in the rendering queue. Images with lower Z will get rendered first and images with higher Z will be rendered last and possibly on top of already drawn images.

      • setDepthLevel

        public void setDepthLevel(int depthLevel)
        Basic setter.
        Parameters:
        depthLevel - Also known as Z level, images get sorted based on this value in the rendering queue. Images with lower Z will get rendered first and images with higher Z will be rendered last and possibly on top of already drawn images.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()

      • getAlpha

        public float getAlpha()
        Basic getter for transparency.
        Returns:
        0.0 for completely invisible 1.0 for solid.

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha(float alpha)
        Basic setter for transparency.
        Parameters:
        alpha - 0.0 for completely invisible 1.0 for solid.

      • setSampleCoordinates

        public void setSampleCoordinates(float startX,
                        float sizeX,
                        float startY,
                        float sizeY)
        Sets which part of the image is to be used by the renderer using relative coordinates. Can render only half of the image for example.
        Parameters:
        startX - Range:[0.0;1.0] Point where the renderer starts sampling
        sizeX - Range:[0.0;1.0] Size of the portion of the image that's to be sampled.
        startY - Range:[0.0;1.0] Point where the renderer starts sampling
        sizeY - Range:[0.0;1.0] Size of the portion of the image that's to be sampled.

      • getSourceStartHorizontal

        public int getSourceStartHorizontal()
        Used internally by the renderer. Using real coordinates rather than relative.
        Returns:
        Point where

      • getSourceSizeHorizontal

        public int getSourceSizeHorizontal()
        Used internally by the renderer. Using real coordinates rather than relative.
        Returns:
        Size of the sample in that axis

      • getSourceStartVertical

        public int getSourceStartVertical()
        Used internally by the renderer. Using real coordinates rather than relative.
        Returns:
        Point where renderer starts sampling

      • getSourceSizeVertical

        public int getSourceSizeVertical()
        Used internally by the renderer. Using real coordinates rather than relative.
        Returns:
        Size of the sample in that axis.

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean b)
        Sets renderables visibility. If set to false renderable won't appear on the screen. True by default
        Parameters:
        b - visibility

      • getVisibility

        public boolean getVisibility()
        Sets renderables visibility. If set to false renderable won't appear on the screen. True by default
        Returns:
        visibility
